Misfire.1: Catastrophic Misfire: You take 2d8 damage and the weapon takes a week to repair at half its value

Misfire.2: Bad Misfire: The weapon will take a long rest to repair for 10% of its base cost.

Misfire.3: Misfire: The weapon requires a short rest to be unjammed and repaired.

Misfire.4: Misfire: The weapon requires a short rest to be unjammed and repaired.

Misfire.5: Minor Misfire: The weapon will take a turn to repair/clear the jam.

Misfire.6: Minor Misfire: The weapon will take a turn to repair/clear the jam.

Misfire.7: Minor Misfire: The weapon will take a turn to repair/clear the jam.

Misfire.8: Minor Misfire: The weapon will take a turn to repair/clear the jam.

Misfire.9: Minor Misfire: The weapon will take a turn to repair/clear the jam.

Misfire.10: Wet Powder: The weapon cannot be used until your next turn.

Primal.2: You are knocked unconscious for 1d6 hours. If you take any damage you must roll a d10. If the roll is above a 7 you wake up.

Primal.3: You must succeed a resistance save against your own DC or take a major wound, taking a minor wound on a pass.

Primal.4: You cast lightning bolt, including yourself in the area of effect.

Primal.5: You cannot cast spells for 1d6 rounds.

Primal.6: A random creature within 30ft of you (including yourself) must succeed on a mental save or be stunned for a minute. On each turn it can repeat the save, ending the stun on a success.

Primal.7: You summon an imp in a random square 10ft from you. This imp is hostile to any creature near it and disappears when dead or after an hour.

Primal.8: Everything within 15 ft. of you (including you) catches on fire, taking 1d10 damage every round until they or another creature use an action to put it out.

Primal.9: You take 1d12 sanity damage and have visions of tentacles.

Primal.10: Your next invocation costs double the number of spellcasting ability points.

Primal.11:
Choose one of the following options 
 A) Flip a coin. On heads you can select an effect from this table. On tails the GM selects an effect. (GM Note: Pick a bad one) 
 B) Reroll this roll.

Primal.12: Every creature within 15 ft. of you regains 5 defence.

Primal.13: The next attack that hits you deals no damage.

Primal.14: A swarm of butterflies appears around you. This blocks line of sight in a 20 ft. radius around you. You are blinded.

Primal.15: You regain 1 defence at the start of every round for a minute.

Primal.16: Pick a creature within 30ft of you. The target must succeed on a resistance save or be deafened for a minute. You can choose to target an empty square if you wish, creating a loud boom instead.

Primal.17: Pick a creature within 30ft of you. The creature has advantage on the next attack it makes within 1 minute.

Primal.18: The next invocation you cast costs half its usual cost.

Primal.19: You can select a target within 30ft. The target must succeed a resistance save or take a minor wound. If you cause a wound in this manner you may heal one minor wound.

Primal.20: You instantly regain all your spent spellcasting ability points

Long.1: Roll on the supreme madness table every hour you are awake. The effect lasts one hour.

Long.2: Each time you take damage roll on the minor madness table. This effect lasts one round.

Long.3: Each time you take damage roll on the minor madness table. This effect lasts one round.

Long.4: The first time you see a hostile creature today you must make a DC 15 mental save or suffer major madness.

Long.5: The first time you see a hostile creature today you must make a DC 15 mental save or suffer major madness.

Long.6: The first time you take damage today roll on the major madness table.

Long.7: The first time you take damage today roll on the major madness table.

Long.8: The first time you take damage today roll on the major madness table.

Long.9: The first time you take damage today roll on the major madness table.

Long.10: The first time you take damage today roll on the major madness table.

Long.15: You feel a little better. Your maximum sanity is increased by 1.

Long.16: You feel a little better. Your maximum sanity is increased by 1.

Long.17: You feel a little better. Your maximum sanity is increased by 1.

Long.18: You feel a little better. Your maximum sanity is increased by 1.

Long.19: You feel a little better. Your maximum sanity is increased by 1.

Long.20: You feel much better. Your maximum sanity is increased by 2.

Minor.1: You fall unconscious. You wake if you take any damage or a creature takes a turn to wake you.

Minor.2: You are jumpy. You gain advantage on initiative tests but have disadvantage on any charisma tests and wisdom tests.

Minor.3: Paranoid. You do not trust anyone. You cannot be a willing target of a spell.

Minor.4: Overconfident. Your armour class is reduced by 1 and you cannot take cover.

Minor.5: Violent. You must succeed on a DC 18 mental save to attack any creature besides the closest enemy.

Minor.6: Brash. You cannot move away from any enemy you see, unless it is towards another enemy.

Minor.7: Mute/gibbering. You cannot speak intelligibly. You cannot cast spells unless they do not require you to speak to cast.

Minor.8: Fear. You are terrified of an object or creature of the GMs choice.

Minor.9: Skin Crawling. You feel like something is crawling over your skin. At the start of each turn you must make a DC 15 mental save or spend your turn trying to stop whatever is crawling on you.

Major.1: You fall unconscious and cannot be woken.

Major.2: You cannot speak or make any other sound.

Major.3: Fear. The GM picks up to three objects or creatures for you to be frightened of.

Major.4: Blind. You believe you are blind and automatically fail any test involving sight. If you are already blind, you are deafened instead.

Major.5: Reckless. You cannot dodge or use cover and your armour class is reduced by 4.

Major.6: Crazed. The creature must roll to determine what actions they will take each round if in combat or each minute if not.

Major.7: Hallucinations. You have disadvantage on every 2d10 roll as you attempt to work out what is real and what is just in your head.

Major.8: Personality Change. You undergo a dramatic personality shift. You might become evil, a coward, greedy, an exact copy of a party member or an enemy. You might even act like an animal or some monster.

Supreme.1:
Shell.
 You cannot take any action. Any creature can pull you along at half speed.

Supreme.2:
Babbling.
You constantly babble intolerantly. You have disadvantage on stealth tests and saying anything takes 3 times as long as normal. If you try to cast a spell it has a 50% chance of failing as you cast it, unless it does not require you to speak.

Supreme.3:
Totem. 
 You choose a totem, while more than 30 ft. from the totem you have disadvantage on every roll. If the totem is destroyed you must roll on the minor, major and supreme madness tables.

Supreme.4:
Night Terrors. 
 The madness has crept into your subconscious and you have awful night terrors when you sleep. Whenever you take a long rest, roll a d6. On a 1, you do not gain the benefits of a long rest.

Supreme.5: Death Wish. You must refuse any healing or medicine while conscious and insist that you deserve to feel the pain.

Supreme.6:
Permanent Damage. 
 Your wisdom score is permanently reduced by 2.

Supreme.7:
Sanguine Fascination. 
 You become infatuated with blood and will go out of your way to observe bleeding wounds regardless of the context.

Supreme.8:
Aggressive. 
 You must always attack an enemy if there is an opportunity to do so. At the end of any combat you must succeed at a DC 15 mental save or attack whatever creatures are around you.

Supreme.9:
Paranoid. 
 You do not trust anyone. You cannot be a willing target of any spell and cannot sleep while there are other creatures around.

Supreme.10:
Merciless. 
 You cannot leave an enemy alive.
